poem:
Chilli Oil Udon  

A bowl for one—  
herbs scatter like thoughts,  
citrus bright  
on the tongue.  
  
Noodles  
tangle in spice,  
a silent dance  
of warmth and  
cool lightness—  
  
salmon  
glimmers pink,  
a swift hint  
of sea.  
  
Taste the breeze  
of summer—  
simple, bold,  
unbound.
